articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Instant View: India government steps up rural funding in last budget before election
articles.description: India's Bharatiya Janata Party-led government poured extra money into support for farmers and a rural jobs program, delivering on Friday its last budget before a general election due by May with the clear aim of winning over votes.
articles.content:

articles.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank third-quarter profit rises more than a fifth
articles.description: Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd, India's fifth-biggest bank by market capitalisation, reported a better-than-expected 22.6 percent rise in third-quarter net profit on Monday, helped by higher interest income and a write-back of provisions made for mark-to-market loss…

articles.author: Chris Thomas
articles.title: Sensex, Nifty edge lower as financials, autos weigh
articles.description: Indian shares slipped on Tuesday as investors locked in profits after a five-day rally, while losses in financials and auto stocks dented sentiment.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Indian shares slipped on Tuesday as investors locked in profits after a five-day rally, while losses in financials and auto stocks dented sentiment. 
Asian shares and U.S. stock futures slipped as pessimism about world growth drove investors away… [+2224 chars]

articles.title: Nifty, Sensex edge higher, caution prevails ahead of earnings
articles.description: Indian shares nudged up slightly on Tuesday, as investors booked some profits and waited on the sidelines for further cues ahead of the start of another corporate earnings season.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Indian shares nudged up slightly on Tuesday, as investors booked some profits and waited on the sidelines for further cues ahead of the start of another corporate earnings season.

articles.title: Sensex, Nifty flat amid global growth worries; Reliance Industries up
articles.description: Indian shares were largely unchanged on Thursday in lacklustre trading amid lingering concerns about global growth and ahead of key political events, though gains in market heavyweight Reliance Industries Ltd put the indexes in the green.

articles.title: Nifty, Sensex muted as global growth, trade worries weigh

articles.author: Vivek Mishra
articles.title: RBI to cut rates again before elections, but no more: Reuters poll
articles.description: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is expected to cut interest rates again next quarter, according to a Reuters poll of economists, with a slim majority forecasting policy easing to occur before the general election in May.
articles.content:
BENGALURU (Reuters) - The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is expected to cut interest rates again next quarter, according to a Reuters poll of economists, with a slim majority forecasting policy easing to occur before the general election in May.
